reviews.sentence: Not so friendly staff. I checked in for a conference and what a problem I had with the not so helpful front desk lady. We checked in under our corporation for conference and all my co workers checked in without a problem I was the last in line and had issues checking in. I asked for a room on a top floor I was finally put on a higher floor only to look at a concrete wall in front of me. After an half hour I was finally in a room. We were staying for 4 nights. When I would leave and return not once was I greeted. I felt very unwelcomed at this hotel. I will not be staying here again.

Boutique Hotel with Excellent Staff. My overall rating is 35 stars. While the front desk staffs service was excellent the place is a bit worn down and mattress seemed aged old and has lost its firmness. In what seems to be a cabinet for a small refrigerator it was vacant with no back panel which gave me the impression that they used to make refrigerators available in the past. When I stay at a hotel for more than couple nights I like to have a refrigerator to keep my water bottles cold and miscellaneous food items fresh. I could not believe their fitness center a tiny room with couple treadmills and hardly any equipments and not exactly conducive for more than 1 to 2 people to use at a time. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who does not need the amenities mentioned in this review as it is conveniently located in gaslamp district and again staffs excellent service makes up for other areas where they lack. Their restaurant was nice although it is with just one bartender serving the entire bar area plus the general dining area. As a foodie I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of their food and this is another aspect that makes it worthwhile to stay with this hotel when visiting downtown San Diego. Service Near gaslamp district and close to many things including N Harbor Drive. Just 10 minutes away from San Diegos Sea World and Whale Watching boat tour Condition of mattress rooms and fitness center.

Great Place to Stay in the Gaslamp. The staff here is great. My check in and out was very friendly and expedient. The lobby design is great with lots of light and elegant design. The elevator going up to the 7th floor was fast I like that. I hate slow elevators. The room was perfect for my business trip. The bed was very comfortable and the bedding drapes and walls complimented each other. The bathroom was smaller than I like but very serviceable. I loved the work space with the free wifi. I did not have a great view or anything in my room but the tv worked great and the lighting in the room was perfect.

Extremely small hot loud rooms. The rooms were extremely small and hot. The AC would not drop below 75 degrees anytime of the day. We chose the view side of the hotel which we were told was a bit loud but had no idea how loud it would be. The view has a lot to be desired. We had partiers on both sides of our room and felt like walls were paper thin. It was SO loud. Valet parking attendants continuously misplaced our keys and we would have to help them find the keys taking about 10 minutes longer that it should have to get our car. The location is good if you want to walk to Gas Lamp Square and Little Italy. Would not recommend this hotel. location AC rugs and towels in bathroom.

a San Diego Native Review. really nice location. we normally stay at the US Grant but this weekend it was nt in the budget so we stayed at the Bristol it was great. our friends were at the Grant and we were just 3 blocks from them so everywhere we needed to be was a short walk. i would stay here again. My husband and i wondered about the earplugs on the night stand we discovered its because of the street noise if you re a light sleeper you do nt want to be on the street side. location location location. and the bed was comfortable but i felt like there should have been a comforter but it was comfortable nonetheless. totally central. we were with a group based at the US Grant walking 3 blocks to meet up there was easy all the fun of downtown just as easy. i d love a big fluffy comforter.

If you like overpriced parking a room with no air conditioning and no fridge sheets that feel wet because it is so muggy and very slow internet stay at the Bristol. I will never return. I have never had a bad experience in San Diego until I booked at this hotel. Needless to say our vacation is more stress than its worth at this point.

Very comfortable. The room was exquisite well appointed way better than the big chains and big too. It was plush. The food in the restaurant was also an eyeopener. I do not usually eat in hotels but this was a very pleasant exception. Highly recommended.

Nice hotel located downtown and near Little Italy. Nice hotel with updated furniture. Staff was fabulous and very helpful. Our room was clean and bed was very comfortable. This hotel is located near so many exciting places to visit. It was some what noisy during the night with downtown traffic but that is to be expected. The parking was a little too expensive at 320 per night but the nice experience was worth the stay. We would absolutely stay there again. Location clean and updated furniture and friendly staff. Little Italy which we love to visit and eat dinner the beach Gas Light District and USS Midway. Parking was 320 too expensive.

Great Weekend Getaway. We stayed at the Bristol Hotel for 3 nights for a weekend getaway. Room 702 was comfy quiet and cozy. The king bed was comfortable and the large television complete with accessible ports to attach your own devices for viewing on the screen was great to come back to after a long day of enjoying the sights of San Diego. there is even a tablet on the nightstand for use area recommendations and such. Though we did not use it it was a nice amenity. The location is quiet central 2 blocks to Horton Plaza for shopping 5 blocks to the Gaslamp District and a short walk to the waterfront. There are plenty of restaurant options just steps from the hotel. At the time we stayed at the Bristol there was construction happening outside on the sidewalk. I do not know if this was due to the construction but the hotel provided ear plugs on the nightstand which was very thoughtful. We did not need to use them the construction was not bothersome at all. The staff was very friendly saying hello and welcoming us every time we left or came into the hotelwe had definitely stay here again.

Excellent. I was in San Diego to attend a three day conference. I had to make a last minute reservation and the hotel I usually stay in The Sofia was booked. As a back up plan I decided to stay at The Bristol because of it is convenience to my meeting. The Bristol is now my go to hotel when I attend meetings in downtown SD. I highly recommend this hotel. I would have like the screen size of the TV to be larger.

Fantastic hotel. The hotel is in the middle in my option of the city. it is walking distance to some many cool sights. I had definitely stay here again. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and in great condition.
Nice rooms great employees good location and reasonably priced for the area.

do not Change a Thing. My husband and I spent two nights over this past weekend at the Bristol. From the time we checked in until the time we checked out we were very happy with our stay. The staff is very friendly helpful competent. Our room was very clean comfortable and quiet. We loved the décor. We were in town for a family birthday. Oh. can not forget great location. Within walking distance of Little Italy and so many other great spots.

Absolutely loved this renovated hotel within blocks of Gaslamp district. My wife and I spent five nights at the Bristol Hotel. The place has recently been renovated and it shows from the clean and bright hallways to the modern upbeat rooms which have a mini refrigerator but no microwave oven. And they all have giant wide screen TVs. Breakfast is simple and filling. there is a bar that opens at five and closes at ten. The staff was helpful and courteous. Not sure why they do not have a snack vending machine. Overall the hotel not only met but exceeded our expectations. Will definitely stay here again.

Good location good value. Clean smartly furnished nice value. Decent continental breakfast Traveled on business could walk to convention center and good restaurants stores etc. Lack of drawers no problem for me plenty of shelf space under huge TV and other places to put stuff. Also not as noisy as other Gaslamp locations I grabbed a room on a high floor in the back very quiet.

Good location. It has a brand new gym on the 9th floor that has everything you need. Nice eating area with fair breakfast. We did n’t hear any noises through the night. The staff were exceptionally nice. Rooms are clean with wood floors that is much much better than carpet for a hotel room.

Loved it. Rooms are very clean and beds are SO comfy. All of the staff here were very friendly and helpful. Location is great. Walking distance to a lot or a quick Uber lyft ride. Would definitely stay again. Water leaked all over the floor every time we showered. Would n’t stop me from staying again though.

Small getaway. My boyfriend and I wanted to spend some alone time together. We loved everything about the hotel everyone was nice and room was so pretty. Everything was walking distance. Very inexpensive. A forsure.

Very clean hotel. Very friendly staff that greets you. Stayed in Fab room. Hardwood floors huge tv refrigerator massive bathroom. Beds not suitable for normal sized middle aged adults. Very small but very comfortable. No view and lots of outside traffic noise on Saturday night. Great location. If we had been smart we had have figured out the mass transit. that is very close with none really riding it. Very weird. Uber fantastic to get places and overall great place to stay. there is very little amenities. Coffee machine in lobby makes disgusting coffee. Yes there is a few homeless but compared to other places not really that bad. None bothered us at all. The restaurant at the Hotel Sofia is ok go have dinner at Dobsons very historic place and staff very nice. Make reservations. We scooted in and managed to get the famous booth that is in the bar part. Upstairs is the main seating. Highly recommend. Locals go here before the theatre and I can not say enough about the food.

1282019 check in It ’s a really great experience staying here. We chose the primo king room. The room is big and cozy with a great view. however I would definitely not choose to have breakfast here again. US 10 per. The location is good pretty close with the trolley and my favorite coffee shop. I would love to stay here for my next trip to San Diego.
